Topic.Title: the reality of the DELL situation

Message.Msg: The reality is Dell should offer $15.00/share or do a tender at $14.00 as Icahn has suggested. That's if he still cares to own this undervalued jewel. With new leadership the stock will be over $15.00 by year-end.

Topic.Title: the reality of the DELL situation

Message.Msg: The PC market is atrocious as can be clearly seen in Dell's earnings. The shift for personal use is mobile and based on the projection that tablets sales will overtake laptops this year is what I would consider surprising and very aggressive. IBM and HP have diversified and have had substantial investment in R&D (considering that is core to both organizations) into the areas that matter such as virtualization and cloud based deployments both of which Dell has really nothing to speak of. When you see Oracle team up with Microsoft you know for sure how dramatically this market is shifting. Carlito and cronies know this is coming and are only playing this out so that they will be in the best position to feed on Dell's carcus once the company, under their plan, arrives at its final destination bankruptcy. Either that or the resulting stress that will come to Dell will leave them in the drivers seat without opposition to do whatever is best for Carlito.

Message.Title: Icahn is the only reason!
Message.Msg: Icahn is the only reason that Dell’s special board committee, which is supposed to be looking out for the best interest of Dell’s shareholders, has gone back to Michael Dell and advised him to raise his offer! If it wasn't for Icahn, shareholders would be screwed!!!

"johndeansmith" you are100% correct. It is obvious that shareholder value and fairness to the shareholders, has not been anywhere near the top concern of the BOD. Their lack of willingness to do their fudiciary duty has been and is criminal.

i have no doubt that Michael Dell's $13.65 offer will be voted down. my concern is that he might go to $15 which is still too low IMO and that it is accepted. not sure if $15 is good enough for Carl but i hope it's not. i want to see Carl take over the company and get all of his guys on the board AND get his guy in the CEO position. Michael has been a DISASTER since returning to CEO - he's been burning shareholder money while competitors have been prospering. it's time for Michael to GO!

Topic.Title: Of course Carlito Icahn wants Dell loaded with debt!

Message.Msg: And its funny he is offering more than Michael Dell, soooooooooooo what is Michael Dell going to do other than take company from the shareholders.

Topic.Title: the reality of the DELL situation

Message.Msg: It seems as thou computers are still very much in use in companies around the world,Dell computer company should have been more aggressive in innovation instead of just waiting on Microsoft to come up with something. Anybody who has used a tablet knows the aggravation of small screens and battery life will lead to other companies coming up with something better.

Message.Title: Small-Cap Tech Stock to Rapidly Double or Triple
Message.Msg: You must research CCUR as soon as possible it is currently just $7.44 per share and has only 8.754mm s/o, a market cap of $65.13mm, cash of $22.37mm, no debt, and an enterprise value of $42.76mm. CCUR's enterprise value is only 0.68X revenues of $63.23mm, 6X operating cash flow of $7.13mm, and 7.64X free cash flow of $5.6mm. CCUR's EPS was up 175% last quarter! CCUR just increased its dividend by 100% to $0.48 per share for a HUGE yield of 6.45%. CCUR leads the video on demand (VOD) delivery business with over 2.4mm VOD streams deployed worldwide and 4 of America's 6 largest cable TV operators as clients. CCUR's business is booming as pay-TV operators upgrade their systems to provide new Network DVR, start-over, and look-back services. CCUR is also powering multi-screen services by delivering video to tablets and smartphones for major cable TV operators like Time Warner Cable! Plus, CCUR offers leading content delivery network (CDN) solutions and just signed a huge CDN deal with Virgin Media! The #2 VOD tech vendor SEAC closed yesterday at $11.83 and is about to break its 52-week high of $12.10. SEAC has an enterprise value of $273.2mm or 1.75X revenues of $156.11mm, 15.67X operating cash flow of $17.43mm, and 20.12X free cash flow of $13.58mm. An enterprise value of 1.75X revenues would value CCUR at $15.20. An enterprise value of 15.67X operating cash flow will value CCUR at $15.32. An enterprise value of 20.12X free cash flow will value CCUR at $15.43. In addition, CCUR provides the #1 Big Data Analytics software solution used by cable TV service providers. CCUR tracks the viewing behavior of 35 million cable TV customers and has already processed 15 billion transactions. Big Data Analytics is the #1 hottest tech space on Wall Street. DATA recent went public at $31 and hit a new 52-week high yesterday of $61.45 for a gain of 98%. DATA's enterprise value is currently 24X revenues vs. CCUR's enterprise value of well below 1X revenues! CCUR is about to explode!

What are the chances of the stock going back to $9?Up to this point i've considered a buyout a sure deal one way or another.It looks like it may drop back down if the deal doesn't happen and i hate to have a margin call.
then you might as well sell now at $13 and change. personally i will take my chances with Icahn!
